item.title: 瑞士财政部长指出全球银行清盘的法律风险
item.description: 周三，瑞士财政部长卡琳-凯勒-萨特（Karin Keller-Sutter）被引述说，国际金融当局必须考虑围绕全球银行潜在清盘的法律风险。【原文：International financial authorities must give consideration to legal risks surrounding the potential winding up of global banks, Swiss Finance Minister Karin Keller-Sutter was quoted as saying on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，埃利奥特重建软银股份并推动 150 亿美元的回购计划
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周三报道，埃利奥特管理公司（Elliott Management）重新持有软银集团价值超过 20 亿美元的股份，并正在推动这家日本科技企业集团启动价值 150 亿美元的股票回购。【原文：Elliott Management has rebuilt a stake worth over $2 billion in SoftBank Group and is pushing the Japanese tech conglomerate to launch a $15 billion share buyback, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: Zara 所有者 Inditex 公布季度销售增长放缓
item.description: Zara 所有者 Inditex 周三表示，本财年第一季度的销售额增长了 7%，符合分析师的预期。【原文：Zara owner Inditex grew its sales by 7% in the first quarter of its fiscal year, it said on Wednesday, in line with analysts' expectations.】

item.title: 独家报道：电动汽车制造商日欧在中国的第三家工厂获得监管部门批准
item.description: 据三位知情人士透露，电动汽车制造商尼奥已获准在中国建设第三家工厂，这将使其获批的总产能提高到100万辆，几乎与特斯拉在上海的大型工厂相当。【原文：Electric vehicle maker Nio has won approval to build a third factory in China that would boost its total approved production capacity to 1 million cars, almost at par with Tesla's massive Shanghai plant, three people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 聚焦：反弹削弱了英国监察机构 "点名羞辱 "计划的优势
item.description: 四名律师告诉路透社记者，英国市场监管机构有望缩小对被调查公司进行点名的计划，因为政府和业界的反弹认为这些建议判断失误，有损伦敦的竞争排名。【原文：Britain's markets regulator is expected to narrow down plans to name companies under investigation, four lawyers told Reuters, after a government and industry backlash labelled the proposals misjudged and harmful to London's competitive ranking.】

item.title: 早间竞标：降息赌注再度升温
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天：【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee:】

item.title: 独家报道前 Meta 工程师起诉公司称因处理加沙内容而被解雇
item.description: 一名前 Meta 工程师周二指控该公司在处理与加沙战争有关的内容时存在偏见，并在诉讼中声称，Meta 因其试图帮助修复导致巴勒斯坦 Instagram 帖子被压制的错误而解雇了他。【原文：A former Meta engineer on Tuesday accused the company of bias in its handling of content related to the war in Gaza, claiming in a lawsuit that Meta fired him for trying to help fix bugs causing the suppression of Palestinian Instagram posts.】

item.title: 澳大利亚通过信用检查法遏制 "即买即付 "行为
item.description: 澳大利亚政府周三出台立法，要求 "即买即付"（BNPL）公司对借款人进行信用调查，旨在像监管其他消费信贷产品一样，监管这一在年轻人中流行的快速发展的行业。【原文：The Australian government on Wednesday introduced legislation that would require buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) firms to run credit checks on borrowers, aiming to regulate the rapidly growing sector popular among youth like other consumer credit products.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因降息预期而上涨；印度成为关注焦点
item.description: 周三，亚洲股市上涨，美元持稳，原因是美国劳动力市场走软，在本周发布重要的就业报告之前，美联储 9 月份降息的预期增强。【原文：Asian stocks rose on Wednesday, while the dollar was steady as a softening U.S. labour market firmed up bets of an interest rate cut in September from the Federal Reserve ahead of a crucial payrolls report this week.】

item.title: 澳大利亚第一季度经济增速放缓，环比增长 0.1
item.description: 由于借贷成本居高不下和通胀仍然高企，抑制了消费支出，澳大利亚经济在三月份放缓，即使利率宽松的前景依然遥遥无期。【原文：Australia's economy slowed to a crawl in the March quarter as high borrowing costs and still-elevated inflation put the brakes on consumer spending, even as the prospect of relief on interest rates remains a distant one.】

item.title: 财新制造业采购经理人指数显示，中国服务业活动强劲，带动就业增加
item.description: 周三的一项私营部门调查显示，5月份中国服务业活动增速为10个月来最快，而人员规模则出现了自1月份以来的首次扩张，这表明第二季度经济将持续复苏。【原文：China's services activity in May accelerated at the quickest pace in 10 months while staffing levels expanded for the first time since January, a private sector survey showed on Wednesday, pointing to sustained recovery in the second quarter.】

item.title: 印度铝业公司控股的诺维丽斯公司推迟美国首次公开募股
item.description: 印度亿万富翁库马尔-曼加拉姆-贝拉（Kumar Mangalam Birla）的印度铝业公司（Hindalco Industries）旗下的 Novelis 公司周二以市场条件为由推迟了首次公开募股。【原文：Novelis, owned by Indian billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla's Hindalco Industries on Tuesday it postponed its initial public offering citing market conditions.】

item.title: 投资者思考大选和美国潜在的宽松政策，新兴货币难见起色
item.description: 路透调查--新兴市场货币未见反弹，投资者思考大选和美国宽松政策的空间【原文：REUTERS POLL-NO REBOUND SEEN FOR EMERGING MARKETS CURRENCIES AS INVESTORS PONDER ELECTIONS, SCOPE FOR US EASING】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，贝莱德和花旗集团支持的集团将在得克萨斯州创办新的全国性证券交易所
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二报道，由贝莱德（BlackRock）和花旗证券（Citadel Securities）支持的一个集团正计划在得克萨斯州创办一家新的全国性证券交易所。【原文：A group backed by BlackRock and Citadel Securities is planning to start a new national stock exchange in Texas, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 交易员转向美国服务业数据，美元重新站稳脚跟
item.description: 周三，在等待加拿大利率决定和美国服务业数据的同时，交易员们减少了对新兴市场的风险押注，美元汇率趋于稳定。【原文：The dollar steadied on Wednesday as traders pared back on riskier bets in emerging markets while waiting on an interest rate decision in Canada and on U.S. services data.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，X 首席执行官琳达-雅卡里诺（Linda Yaccarino）失去了顶头上司乔-贝纳罗赫（Joe Benarroch）。
item.description: X Corp.华尔街日报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，X 公司首席执行官琳达-雅卡里诺（Linda Yaccarino）的业务运营主管乔-贝纳罗奇（Joe Benarroch）即将离职。【原文：X Corp. Chief Executive Officer Linda Yaccarino's head of business operations, Joe Benarroch, is leaving the company, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国石油和燃料库存大幅增加，石油连续第六天下滑
item.description: 周三亚市早盘，油价小幅收跌，此前一份行业报告显示美国原油和燃料库存增加，加剧了市场对需求增长的担忧。【原文：Oil prices extended losses slightly from the previous session in early Asian trading on Wednesday after an industry report showed builds in U.S. crude and fuel stockpiles, adding to concerns around demand growth.】

item.title: 日本服务业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，日本服务业活动扩大涨幅，价格压力持续存在
item.description: 周三的一项私营部门调查显示，日本 5 月份的服务业活动延续了强劲的增长势头，通胀压力持续存在，从而推高了今年再次加息的预期。【原文：Japan's service activity extended robust gains in May, a private sector survey showed on Wednesday, amid persistent inflationary pressures that have boosted expectations for another interest rate hike this year.】

item.title: SEKO 赢得美国海关机构有条件的复职许可
item.description: 私营企业 SEKO Logistics 表示，美国海关与边境保护局（CBP）有条件地恢复了其参与两项重要国际贸易计划的资格，但仍未查明导致暂停资格的违规行为。【原文：Privately held SEKO Logistics said U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) has conditionally reinstated its participation in two vital international trade programs, but still has not identified the violations that led to the suspensions.】

item.title: 策略师表示，美元将走软，但美联储需要降息：路透调查
item.description: 路透社调查显示，外汇策略师普遍认为美元估值过高，美元近期的持续走强将在未来 12 个月内让位于小幅疲软。【原文：The dollar's relentless strength in the recent past will make way for minor weakness over the next 12 months, according to FX strategists in a Reuters poll, who generally agreed the dollar was overvalued.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称中国人工智能芯片公司为确保台积电生产而降低设计等级
item.description: 四位知情人士称，面对美国的制裁，一些中国人工智能芯片公司目前正在设计功能较弱的处理器，以保留进入台湾半导体制造股份有限公司（TSMC）生产的机会。【原文：Some Chinese AI chip companies are now designing less powerful processors to retain access to Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) production in the face of U.S. sanctions, four people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 法官将拜耳 22.5 亿美元的 Roundup 判决减至 4 亿美元
item.description: 一名宾夕法尼亚州的男子称，他因接触拜耳公司的驱集除草剂而患上了癌症，周二，宾夕法尼亚州的一名法官将拜耳公司在美国的一项价值 22.5 亿美元的判决削减至 4 亿美元。【原文：A Pennsylvania judge on Tuesday slashed a $2.25 billion U.S. verdict against Bayer to $400 million for a Pennsylvania man who said he developed cancer from exposure to the company's Roundup weedkiller.】

item.title: 能源部长格兰霍姆表示，耗电量巨大的数据中心促使美国与大科技公司进行谈判
item.description: 美国能源部长詹妮弗-格兰霍姆（Jennifer Granholm）告诉路透社，乔-拜登总统的政府正在要求大型科技公司投资新的气候友好型发电设备，以满足其激增的需求。【原文：President Joe Biden's administration is asking big technology companies to invest in new climate-friendly power generation to cover their surging demand, U.S. Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm told Reuters.】

item.title: TikTok 称网络攻击针对包括 CNN 在内的品牌和名人账户
item.description: 短视频应用 TikTok 的发言人周二表示，该公司已采取措施阻止针对多个品牌和名人账户的网络攻击，其中包括新闻网 CNN。【原文：Short video app TikTok has taken measures to stop a cyberattack targeting several brand and celebrity accounts, including news network CNN, a spokesperson for the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体要求纳斯达克配合对其股票交易的调查
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的社交媒体平台 Truth Social 的所有者公司周二表示，已要求纳斯达克配合对所谓 "裸 "卖空者操纵其股票市场的指控进行调查。【原文：The company that owns Donald Trump's social media platform Truth Social said on Tuesday it had requested the Nasdaq's cooperation with any investigations into the alleged market manipulation in its shares by so-called "naked" short sellers.】

item.title: 耶伦称法案发行并非旨在 "糖衣炮弹
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周二驳斥了共和党参议员的说法，即财政部正在故意以更高的利率增发短期国库券，试图在 11 月总统大选前刺激经济。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Tuesday rejected suggestions by Republican senators that the Treasury is deliberately increasing issuance of short-term Treasury bills at higher interest rates to try to stimulate the economy ahead of the November presidential election.】

item.title: 美国调查多个州无法拨打无线电话的报告
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会周二表示，它正在调查美国多个州的消费者无法拨打无线电话的原因。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission said on Tuesday it was investigating why consumers in multiple U.S. states are unable to make wireless calls.】

item.title: 瑞波公司总裁称，加密货币行业的游说活动将在美国大选中获得回报
item.description: 美国加密货币公司瑞波（Ripple）的总裁 "乐观地 "认为，加密货币行业的游说活动将在今年的美国大选中取得成果，在此之前，她的公司帮助该行业领导了创纪录的筹款活动，以支持那些对加密货币友好的政治候选人。【原文：The president of U.S. crypto firm Ripple is "optimistic" that a lobbying push by the crypto industry will yield results in this year's U.S. elections, after her company helped the industry lead a record fundraising haul to back political candidates who are crypto-friendly.】

item.title: 早间竞价政治和市场波动刺激市场上涨
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: ADM 称其全球供应主管将离开公司
item.description: 据路透社周二看到的一封内部邮件称，Archer-Daniels-Midland 公司负责全球供应链和采购的高级副总裁、执行委员会成员 Camille Batiste 将于下月离职，ADM 公司随后也证实了这一消息。【原文：Camille Batiste, Archer-Daniels-Midland's senior vice president of global supply chain and procurement and a member of its executive council, is leaving the company next month, according to an internal email seen by Reuters on Tuesday and later confirmed by ADM.】
